intro: Amyema umbellata, commonly known as the mountain cabbage, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers, which are arranged in an umbel, giving it its scientific name. Amyema umbellata is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
